test_read_dict()¶
test_read_modules_from_csv_and_save_to_database()¶
test_read_strands_from_csv_and_save_to_database()¶

Test for feature to add valeus from csv file to a database

test_reads_correct_csv_headers()¶

Test that the reader reads in the correct headers for the Module data model when reading from a csv exported from the example sqlite3 database.

test_reads_in_correct_number_of_modules()¶

Tests that the csv reader does indeed read in the correct number of modules from the csv file. The length of the list of modules it returns should be 113.

test_reads_in_programmes()¶
test_reads_one_module()¶

Test the reader can successfully read in the first module of the csv file, and return a Module object with the correct primary key. Note: Django compares equality between model.Model classes on the primary key. We could test the rest of the attributes by looking at each instance’s __dict__, but there are formatting issues between strings in the test_module and the read-in module (eg in newline characters in ‘summary’) that would always return False.

test_reads_strands()¶

Tests the correct number of strands are read in.

tags = {'integration'}¶
test_psql_connection()¶

Tests that a connection can be made to a psql database. If not, then it’s probably something to do with the DATABASE_URL in the .env
